Job Description

Summary:
  • Seeking a skilled molecular biologist to perform independent antibody, antigen, and enzyme engineering projects and provide technical support for immunoassay prototyping teams.
  • The candidate must possess strong molecular biology, protein biochemistry and mammalian cell line development background and innovative thinking, as well as strong written and communication skills.
  • Candidate must be familiar with current technologies in the scientific literature and conduct effective literature searches.
  • A successful candidate will conduct advanced research on an antibody, antigen, and enzyme engineering, expression, purification, characterization and cell line development.
Main Responsibilities:
  • Position requires expertise in molecular biology and immunology to conceive, plan, design and conduct advanced independent protein engineering research.
  • Design experiments and interpret results with a solid understanding of enzyme and binding kinetics.
  • Design experiments, author protocols, and introduce new technologies. Investigate and develops new procedures.
  • May act as project leader and provides technical direction and feedback to others. Interact s with other groups and shares information; Participates in team activities. Trains lower-level scientists.
  • Submits ideas for inventions; publishes; innovates through patent filings and/or scientific publications
  • Performs FTO's (Freedom to Operate).
Core Job Responsibilities:
  • Responsible for implementing and maintaining the effectiveness of the quality system.
  • Designs and conducts experiments, accomplishes established milestones and summarizes data, interprets, results and draws conclusions. Evaluates data using analytical methodologies to achieve results. Recommends options for future experiments.
  • Presents scientific observations to others. Trains lower-level scientists.
  • Expertise and Problem Solving: Identifies technical alternatives. Utilizes multiple analytical instruments. Anticipates, recognizes and resolves technical problems.
  • Project Planning: Participates in project planning, updates and process improvements. Implements project plans comprehending resource, budget, facility and regulatory requirements.
  • Translates top-level goals to specific project level goals for individual team member. Establishes and reviews complex plans for multiple projects or activities. Plans resource allocation and distribution.
  • Scientific Leadership: Submits ideas for inventions; publishes; innovates through patent filings and/or scientific publications.
  • Perform FTO's (Freedom to Operate).
  • Economic Profitability: Provide direction to project team to meet economic profitability (EP) profile for the project (product cost analysis).
  • Lab Safety: Participates in lab safety.
  • Documentation: Appropriately documents experimental procedures and results according to established guidelines
Position Accountability / Scope:
  • Accountable across functional areas/programs within division. Contributes to project plan. Responsible for project completion.
Minimum Qualifications:
  • PhD. in Molecular Biology or Biochemistry with 2+ years research or industrial experience
  • Or M.S. degree with research experience sufficient to demonstrate equivalency.
